name: BSU
description:
The Mason Middle School Black Student Union (BSU) is a student group that focuses on connecting Black students and allies in a welcoming and supportive environment.

BSU is open to all MMS students--7th and 8th graders!

name: Builders Club
description:
Builders Club is an international student-led organization providing members with opportunities to perform service, build character and develop leadership.

Everyone is Welcome in Builders Club.  We learn how to lead and make things happen. We discover how to work with each other and bring out the best in one another. Best of all, we make friends who care as much as we do about creating a better world.

name: Comets in Action
description: Together, peer buddies and students with disabilities will play games, make crafts, and generally have a good time socially. We meet once per month after school on the third Wednesday of the month.

name: Drama Club
description: Students in Drama Club perform a musical in March.

name: Dungeons and Dragons Club (DnD Club)
description: Adventurers wanted! If you have ever wanted to play the table top fantasy adventure game Dungeons and Dragons this is your club! We meet once a week to play in groups of 4 as you progress through a campaign. No experience? No problem. Our club leaders would love to help you build a character and get started rolling those dice!

name: Girls 4 Girls
description: Girls 4 Girls is designed to give all girls a safe place to come together and target the unique challenges girls face in our modern world. This club will give girls the tools and confidence they need to help create a kinder and more supportive girl-to-girl environment. Our mission is to create a safe and welcoming space to connect and support each other. The MHS Girls 4 Girls high school mentors plan and run each meeting to make an authentic experience to create and build friendships.

name: GSA
description:
The Mason Middle School GSA is a student group that focuses on connecting students in the LGBTQ+ community and their allies.  

GSA is open to all MMS students--7th and 8th graders!

name: Mathcounts
description: Strong math skills/abilities

name: MMS Art Club
description: Art Club is for any 7th or 8th grade student who enjoys making art and has a desire to expand on their art experiences outside of the school day. Club members select from a wide variety of art and craft type projects they are interested in and they vote on the projects they find the most interesting to work on for the semester. Students can choose to work on the featured project, or bring their own, digital devices (tablets) to create with. Students are encouraged to share their work and explore new media while making new friends and contributing to a community of young artists within our school. Projects may include drawing, painting, digital art, sculpture, polymer clay, paper quilling, tie dye, printmaking, macrame, collage, watercolor, scratch art, crochet, calligraphy/decorative lettering, glass fused jewelry, basket making, metal reposse', paper lanters, origami and more! We generally make about 6 projects per semester. The $10 fee is for materials. Because of room capacity, the club is limited to no more than 40 students per semester.

name: MMS Cooking Club
description: MMS Cooking Club is a unique opportunity for students to learn basic cooking and baking skills in their own kitchens!  Presented in an online, video conference format, the MMS Cooking class will present students with the opportunity to complete a variety of recipes from start to finish and then share with their families!

name: MMS Esports
description: MMS Esports is dedicated to giving games a place to get together, have fun gaming, and compete in Esports Leagues.

name: MMS Giving Crew
description:
Would you like to help puppies in puppy mills? Would you like to advocate for kids suffering from terminal diseases? Would you like to get involved in your community? If you answered yes to this question, the Philanthropy Club wants you!!! Through this club, you will find a cause close to your heart, experience it by volunteering on-site, and possibly even win a cash prize of $1000 dollars for your cause !!! So make a difference in your community and join us!

~Sandalee, Senali, and Mrs. Carney

Email Us!
carneysa@masonohioschools.com

name: MMS Go Club
description: This club focuses on gaining interest for the traditonal board game of Go, teaching, and learning together.

name: MMS National History Day Club
description: Visit https://nhd.org/en/ for more information about National History Day

name: MMS Student Council
description: MMS Student Council is an organization of Mason 7th and 8th grade students who are interested in helping to make our school and our community a better place to live and learn.

name: MMS Yearbook
description: Creating memories for the Middle School.

name: Muslim Students Association (MSA)
description: The purpose of Muslim Student Association (MSA) is to provide a safe, stress-free, and fun space for Muslim students to improve and support our own community [Ummah]; we promote open dialogue regarding issues affecting the local, national, and international Islamic community. We desire to share the beauty and diversity of the global Muslim community while having a positive impact on our middle school and the larger Mason City School community.

name: NoteWorthy
description: NoteWorthy is an auditioned pop a cappella ensemble that meets FIRST SEMESTER ONLY after school on WEDNESDAYS from 2:35-3:45 in the MMS Choir Room 609.  Auditions are scheduled in late August and are open to any MMS student.  There is a $40 club fee for NoteWorthy (no student will be refused due to financial hardship).  NoteWorthy performs in the A Cappella Clinic (Oct.) and the 7th and 8th grade choral concerts (Nov/Dec). Visit the Schoology Group page for NoteWorthy for specific information on auditions and events.

name: Power of the Pen
description: Power of the Pen is a competitive writing team. If you love creative writing, try out for Power of the Pen in the fall!

name: Stage Crew
description: Stage Crew works behind the scenes of the musical, running all the technical aspects of the show, such as lights, sound, scene changes, props, etc. In addition, students in art crew help paint sets and props.

name: Student Impact
description: This group meets on Thursday morning for about 20 minutes to fellowship with one another, have a brief discussion about scripture, and pray for each other, our school, and our community.
